account.note:
🌏 Born at 312 PPM

Retired NGO executive doing my best to stay informed and raise awareness about environmental crises, climate breakdown, and the rapacious, murderous impact of greedy capitalists and the politicians they own.

Why the name? Back in the day, empires placated their citizens with "bread and circuses." Now we get fast food and apps. But it's all basically the same — distraction from what's REALLY happening.

descendants.content: @breadandcircuses I was born when there were only half the amount of people on the planet. It’s a sad state that we can’t seem to adapt though, there are so many low-hanging fruit for reducing emissions, which remain unused. Tools like speed limits in Germany, taxation on airline fuels, etc.

account.note:
If you look at my weather posts - check the timestamp too, i dont edit them when they're out of date!

I typically post about #science, #news, #weather, #climate, equal rights advocacy, & how terrible the police are. Some #travel photos too.

I've worked as a chef, baker, molecular biologist, & freelance writer.

Art, graffiti, travel (80+ countries & 50 states), photography, tea, #sewing, reading, cooking, crochet, #cycling, cannabis, dogs, & #antiracism are some of my interests.

account.note:
Chiant comme un meeting du PSU des années 70. Franchement gonflant avec mes postures permanentes.

Toxic idealist. Moral narcissist. Russian troll farm and maga agent provocateur.

But you know what? I'm happy.

If you want to follow me, follow me.

If you want to block me, block me.

If you want to ping me to tell me you're blocking me, ping me to tell me you're blocking me, but the joke's on you.

card.title: Misha (@MishaVelthuis@social.edu.nl)
card.description:
Attached: 2 images

For some years now, I have seen this graph go around on social media. It's a powerful image, because it shows so clearly what is happening under our watch. 

But it does not show us when it was made.

And that is a problem: it might show us that if you are currently 30, 50% of all the #CO2 that has been emitted since 1751 has been emitted in your lifetime. But that percentage changes over time.

So I made a new, customizable version that is more #future proof

https://mishathings.org/2024-08-12-how-much-co2-has-been-emitted-in-my-lifetime.html

#climate
card.image_description: A graph showing the percentage of global CO2 emissions since 1750 occurring in your lifetime.

descendants.content: @MishaVelthuis Can you update us when you finish the project?

descendants.content:
@breadandcircuses

It's already done!

It was a relatively small project.

The product was simply an (interactive) update of that graph.

And if the screen of your current device is wide enough (as in, not a phone), you should be able to play with (and download) the new graph here: http://mishathings.org:8050/

(It's running on my own server, so it might be a bit slow).
